mentions.context: A Matlab package including both baselines is available for download from the ASVspoof website.
Briefly, it is sourced from the Voice Cloning Toolkit (VCTK) corpus [7], a multispeaker, native-English speech database of read sentences recorded in a hemi-anechoic chamber.
It utilizes an x-vector [19] embedding extractor network that was pretrained 8 for the VoxCeleb recipe of the Kaldi toolkit [20].
Waveform generation methods vary from waveform concatenation to neural network-based waveform modelling techniques including WaveNet [8].

The remaining three sub-systems are based upon either mean-variance normalized Mel-scaled spectrograms or raw audio and either convolutional recurrent neural network (CRNN), Wave-U-Net [37] or raw audio CNN classifiers.

Results for 2015 and 2019 LA databases shows that progress in anti-spoofing has kept apace with progress in TTS and VC research, including neural network-based waveform modelling techniques including WaveNet [8]; EERs and min t-DCFs are similar, despite the use of state-ofthe-art neural acoustic and waveform models to generate spoofing attacks in the ASVspoof 2019 database.
